website_summaries.verdict: Great value for a quality lens. The wide aperture allows for low-light photography. Has great edge-to-edge sharpness.
pros: This Canon-compatible DSLR lens is far less expensive than comparable branded lenses but offers remarkable sharpness and clarity
cons: No STM motor, so autofocus is a little noisy

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this lens for the 4 short months that it actually worked. Seller claims item comes with 1 yr warranty but does not respond to claims. This lens has been attached to my camera since I purchased and has been fully protected with cap and my camera kept in bag when not in use. It has been greatly cared for with minimal use... maybe 300 photos taken on it. Suddenly stopped focusing properly and causing a malfunction error on camera. Images show in focus through viewfinder but all images come out blurry once captured. Cleaned the contacts and still doesn’t work. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens. It arrived last week and I tried it out right away with a senior portrait shoot and used it the entire time, despite having an 85mm 1.8 in my bag as well. I'm obsessed!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed an inexpensive lens for my teenage daughter to learn photography. I chose the Yongnuo based on the good reviews versus the Canon version and the obvious price difference. First thing I noticed when I received it was the rubber/focus ring was completely off. I had to put it back on and it even then, it had a very loose fit. After 10-15 shots my camera showed "Err 01 Communications between the camera and lens is faulty. Clean the lens contacts." The connections were clean and all my other lenses work perfectly. Sent it back for a refund. I'll try the Canon F1.8 and hope I get a better result.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be any more happy with this lens! I have had it for about 2 months now and it works beautifully and the images or nice and sharp. The Bokah on the lens is amazing! This is an amazing lens for the price! Update: This lens is amazing! Is amazing! Not just for the money it is stand-alone awesome! The focus is right on and very very crisp clean images. It stays on my camera in 90% of the time. I can't say enough about this lens! I am in awe of what it can do!
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok piece of glass at an amazing price. Autofocus is very noisy and takes forever, but I got what I paid for. Here's some unedited photos taken with the lens at a party last night.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Raybon

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be beat at this price!
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty new to the DSLR world, so I wanted to build skills before dropping a ton of cash on expensive equipment, I picked this 50mm lens up instead of the canon one (which as far as glass goes is still cheap at $129). Right out of the box I was happy with the lens, it comes with both front and rear caps, came packaged well, and the pictures I took were great right away, buttery smooth bokeh and soft focus. Highly recommend, and I’m definitely going to get more by this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rad AstronautTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to return it and get my money back
customer_reviews.text: I'm very displeased with this purchase. After two weeks of using the lens it's stopped focusing and would not unmount from my camera body, it had to be forced out. I'd like to return it and get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Dreana L.

customer_reviews.title: I have to say I'm very pleased and have been using this lens for many of ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical when I first saw this lens. I watched many reviews and finally decided to pull the trigger. I have to say I'm very pleased and have been using this lens for many of things and very often. I have attached a few photos and a video review as well for reference. Great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: EdTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Like the 1.8, image quality OK. Autofocus slow for action shots.
customer_reviews.text: What I like: Price; image quality; the 1.8 for low light photos. Where the low price shows: Slow autofocus (too slow for action photos, fine for general use); minimum focus longer than Canon 50m lens, so not great for macro. It you want a 50 for portraiture, event shots or landscape, it's OK. Posted by a guy who carries a camera bag for work, and shoots community-sports pix. When using it for indoor sports (basketball), I use the manual focus to pick a spot on the floor, and wait for the action to get there, rather than wait for the camera to autofocus.
customer_reviews.author: Keys Cuda

customer_reviews.title: Great "Bokeh" effect even in lower light settings
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat concerned at first when I received this lens as there was a fingerprint on the inside glass. Can't tell if this was a refurbished lens, or if a factory worker just has no clue what they are doing. However after I cleaned the lens and took a few photo's I was very impressed. The lens is lightweight due to the cheaper materials but my camera seems to snap the pictures quickly and crisply. Great "Bokeh" effect even in lower light settings. Overall I'm very happy with my purchase despite the smudge.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice lens for the price! I am just learning action photography and this thing is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Ober

customer_reviews.title: Lens Barrel Rattles
customer_reviews.text: I thought, what the heck I'll give it a shot. Got the lens and put it on my camera and I noticed it was slow to react, take the photo, compared to my canon lens. Okay, not a big deal, you get what you pay for. But the reason I returned it was the lens barrel was very loose. Not sure this is a character feature of this lens but it just didn't seam right. Normally I would gust have Amazon ship me another but I have a suspicion this is how they're made.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi S.

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: The moment this lens arrived I knew it was trash. The lens itself is so light you can tell they put nothing into it (as compared to the same kind of lens from Canon, which is heavy and nice). Upon opening the lens caps for the first time I found that not just one, but BOTH lenses were dirty and dusty already! What?? How did you even manage that?! I put it straight back in the packaging and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal product
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal product. Very sharp and fast lens. I am a professional photographer (this means people pay me for portraits and wedding), so I need reliable equipment that works that I can depend on. This one is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Silverwolf70

customer_reviews.title: Good quality photos for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This lens feels rly cheap compared to the original but surprisingly the picture quality is great. I got it for my teen brother since I didn’t want to spend lot of money on an original canon lens for him and it works very good. He likes it a lot and I’ve borrowed it from him whenever I forget mine when we’ve gone to places. Would recommend if you don’t want to pay the full price for the original lens.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth & Riki Suzuki

customer_reviews.title: Not a single clear photo.
customer_reviews.text: I’m incredibly disappointed. I’m not sure if my lens is defective or what the issue is, but I can’t get a clear photo. I’ve only had this lens for a month and a half, and only used it for a few shoots. I have to stop using it during my shoots because every photo is grainy. I gave it a really good chance, but my kit lens is better than this one. Which is sad because my kit lens still isn’t that great. I had such high hopes 😞
customer_reviews.author: Tiana Ells

customer_reviews.title: cheaply manufactured
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I bought this a little over a year ago. When I went to use it yesterday the autofocus mechanism had broke. I could hear the plastic piece rattling around inside the lens. Now it’s worthless. I keep all my lenses in padded pouches and the pouches in a padded case. Apparently that was not enough to protect against the cheapness of this lens. I’ll be buying a real Cannon lens now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Beats Canons nifty 50 Easy.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lens, Nice sharp pics and shoot at F12 or more and you get some nice scenery shots..Very good in low light also,No IS but the Canon Nifty 50 doesn't either,,Half the price and better pics!
customer_reviews.author: R Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Best Value Lens
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I thought I’d be buying a junky lens for this price. But at the insistence from my friend that this was well worth trying, I pulled the trigger. I’m a wedding photographer and have already used this lens on multiple shoots with fantastic results. If you’re looking for straight up quality with no regards to price, obviously go and buy yourself a new canon version of this lens (I love that lens as well), but if you’re looking for the best value in terms of price to quality ratio, you just can’t beat this.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: "Err 01 Communications between the camera and lens is faulty. Clean the lens contacts."
customer_reviews.text: While not nearly the quality of the Canon, I was OK with this lens for a while. Now it is about a year from purchase (used minimally), and I get the error others have reported" "Err 01 Communications between the camera and lens is faulty. Clean the lens contacts." I then take it off, shut off the camera, put it back on and then get 2-3 shots before it happens again. The picture quality and build was never Canon quality and now it's essentially unusable. I've learned my lesson and will buy a Canon to replace this.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Fossen

customer_reviews.title: Ships Fast! Take off plastic!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with rate of shipping! Pictures look great! Only thing that you have to make sure to do. When you first take the lens covers off the lens. On the glass pieces on both sides there is a thin piece of plastic you need to remove or else your pictures will be blurry!
customer_reviews.author: Josiah

customer_reviews.title: Cheap lens... great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't focus particularly fast or well. Image quality is good. I'm used to pro or pro-sumer glass, so it was an experiment which left me a little nonplussed. It's a great value tho... so maybe a 4 star rating. If you're just starting out, start here. Learn what you like and what you need before spending big bucks on a super expensive lens. If you're a long time 'tog, with a lot of time behind real canon lenses, you will likely be let down. OR just stuff it in the bottom of your bag for a backup. (shooting on canon 1ds Markii, and a eos R mirrorless.)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great value lense!
customer_reviews.text: New photographer here. I bought this lens for my Canon T6. Originally, I was considering this lens soley for the price. I expected it to be low quality. After checking reviews online and looking at comparisons to more expensive lenses, I realized that may not be the case. This lens is awesome. Great quality photos. I highly recommend it as a great first step away from your kit lens. This lens should be in every amature's bag! **It comes with a little piece of protective film on the back. Dont forget to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely LOVE this lens
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this lens. the bokeh is beautiful and very clear in natural light! and word of advice, take off BOTH films of plastic from lens before use. At first I thought I had wasted my money and should've invested in a Canon 50mm 1.8, but I noticed the plastic film on the inside too when I unmounted the lens, and voila a crisp clear picture! it definitely compares to the more expensive Canon model. Save $$ and go this route :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rich Color
customer_reviews.text: This lens just arrived in the mail and I am pretty pleased thus far. I tested it's ability to focus and color quality on my Yorkie and I think everything looks great. The color is rich but at times inconsistent. I've previously owned a Canon 50mm 1.4 and moving forward I will purchase this lens as my replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Lover

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this lens. It took a while for me to determine that the lens is consistency fuzzy. Just long enough to be beyond the the window for returning it. If you take a gamble with this lens, keep in mind that you need to request a return before a month is up.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B

customer_reviews.title: Best practice lens out there - hands down!
customer_reviews.text: The "nifty fifty" has a reputation of being labeled as a must-have for both novice and professional photographers. If someone was to remove the Yongnuo branding and put Canon on it, it'd be hard to tell the difference. This lens is fast, sharp and inexpensive! This lens is an absolute must have for anyone and everyone, whether you're just learning how to shoot or in need of an amazingly priced lens, this is the right choice. Sure, this lens is plastic and can feel cheaply built, but the potential photo quality captured through this lens makes it all worth it!
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Lenses would NOT focus no matter what!!! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Well this didn’t work for me at all. I have a cannon rebel T6 and I made sure that this lease would be compatible and it jsut didn’t work. It took pictures but it did NOT focus! No matter what I did it jsut wouldn’t focus! I even took it to a professional photographer and she couldn’t get it work and told me to return it so I did. I was definitely it happy. I’d just save a little extra cash and buy a name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Natedogqwe

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is exactly what I was looking for, and not nearly the cost of what everybody said I should be buying. I couldn't be happier with this lens, it takes great pictures and fit my Canon camera perfectly. Would definitely purchase again, but don't think I will need to
customer_reviews.author: S. Oakley

customer_reviews.title: For the price, excellent
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try out a prime lens since I have several zoom lenses. I got used to having the zoom option so I didn't to spend much on a prime lens as I learned to adapt my workflow to it. This lens is outstanding for the price. I would never bring it to a shoot for a client, the quality of the image reminds me of a 90s soap opera. With that being said, I have had a lot of fun shooting with this and getting some surprising glamour shots out of basic product shots. I used this with adapters on the Sony FS5, BMPCC 4k, and Canon T6i.
customer_reviews.author: Matt L

customer_reviews.title: If you don't need autofocus this might be acceptable
customer_reviews.text: While this lens is an F1.8 lens, the autofocus is nearly unusable. The majority of the photos that I have taken with the Yongnuo YN50mm are blurry. I am used to using Canon branded lenses with flawless operation. Autofocus on this lens is far to slow to keep up with even the slowest moving subjects. I have tried this lens in a variety of lighting situations in both indoors and outdoors. If you are willing to focus manually and limit the lighting conditions that you use it in, then it might be acceptable. Save your money and buy a better lens.
customer_reviews.author: Dimeadozen

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures/videos but with 2 caveats
customer_reviews.text: As long as you know this is a "niddy fiddy" and how that translates on an APS-C you'll be happy with the pictures and videos you can get even in lower light settings. (Nice bokeh too if that's your thing.) Now the fine print. It doesn't have image stabilization so it ain't great for "action" videos. And if you use the automatic focus it may hunt a bit....LOUDLY! It's not an STM, clearly. But if you know what you're getting this is a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Rebuck

customer_reviews.title: Worth for money. 100% recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I am 100% happy about this product. As a beginner I am really satisfied with this purchase. I have been using this for a year now. I don’t really see any problem with this. I recommend this product. There is a very minor detail I need to mention. When this guy tries to autofocus there is a little mechanical sound and if you use a good mic on top of the camera sometimes this sounds records in the video. I hope they will make this sound go away in future.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR VIDEO. Photos ONLY
customer_reviews.text: Although this "can" be used for video, don't waste your time. The AF mode is SO LOUD that it makes anything you are shooting unusable if you are recording audio. It sounds like grinding sand/plastic. If you were only going to use it for photography, this would be great. The picture quality is amazing and gives you that beautiful bokeh background. Save up another $40 and get the Canon. You will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Trash!
customer_reviews.text: My previous review is below... After owning for a year the camera cannot communicate with the lens half the time... Shots come or Ivey exposed half the time, otherwise the look l like crap and do not like nearly as good when I first bought it. Amazing image quality for the price. Super sharp and smooth colors. Is much more difficult to auto focus than say a smaller apurture lens. Also seems very close up in died on cropped sensor camaras such as rebels. But amazing quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Willett

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it- it’s a waste
customer_reviews.text: I am highly disappointed with this product. It had great reviews, so I thought it would work for us. It didn’t. I have barely had it a month. By the second time I used it, the Auto focus already didn’t work. I have not dropped it or done anything to it. It has stayed in protector cases inside a case. Highly disappointed... wish I could get a refund
customer_reviews.author: Blake Ross

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bargain nifty 50mm
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely my favorite lens in my kit. At $45, it's nearly 1/3 the cost of the Canon EF 50mm f/1.8 STM lens, and while it lacks the STM feature, it's still a must-buy for the majority of beginner/intermediate photographers. The depth-of-field "bokeh" effect the Yongnuo YN50mm lens simply elevated my game. It's become my go-to lens for portrait shots and still photography. Regarding experience: I'm not a professional photographer, but I've been shooting with Canon EF SLR and DSLR cameras for a little over 12 years now with about 15 years of Photoshop experience to support it.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan VI

customer_reviews.title: bought this for use for family portraits, after a ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this for use for family portraits, after a few months began hearing a rattling in the lens housing and the mechanism for the auto focus began to stick, now its completely inoperable.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, great price.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great replica of the nifty fifty. Sharp pictures and excels in low light. 1.8 is very nice especially for price. I hope yongnuo comes out with a wide angle 1.4-1.8 I will definitely buy it. I have done astrophotography with this but the 50mm is to narrow, that's why I hope for a wider one 20mm or less. Especially if your camera is crop censor and not full frame. It's a great lens and it's a bargain. Below is photo of Milky Way I took with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to create soft / blurred backgrounds like professional photos
customer_reviews.text: Easy to create soft / blurred backgrounds like professional photos. Once you know how to do get the effect you realize half of those 'pros' you see your friends hire for wedding photos are nothing but over-priced one trick ponies with a $50 lens! Maybe I will start charging $3000 for an afternoon of photos and 30 minutes cropping a dozen pictures out of the lot ;)
customer_reviews.author: WooHoo2You

customer_reviews.title: Smooth as butter!
customer_reviews.text: I am by no means a professional photographer. I bought this lens a couple months ago, and when I initially received it I wasn’t very impressed. Today after some minor camera setting tweaking (Canon T2i) this lens really showed its true colors. I haven’t tried the Canon nifty fifty, but I can’t imagine it’s much better than this Yongnuo. Pros: lightweight, smoooooooooth, very clear Cons: lightweight (not sure how it will hold up over time) Verdict: great cheap lens for beginners. 10/10 would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Bosing

customer_reviews.title: My photos (so far) have turned out excellent. Yes
customer_reviews.text: I am quite surprised by the quality of this lens. My photos (so far) have turned out excellent. Yes, the motor is a bit loud on AF, but I usually shoot manual anyway. I took a chance based on the reviews on this lens and I was not disappointed. I saved $75 and received a quality lens that shoots beautiful portraits.
customer_reviews.author: PJTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Yeah it’s worth it
customer_reviews.text: For a 50 dollar lens it’s not bad at all. Pretty clear thru out the whole image. Not a tack driving image quality lens but it’s alot better than I expected for a 50 dollar lens. Fit and finish of it are quite well. A little to much play in the barrel for my liking. AF is a little bit off sometimes and I suggest just using it in manual focus mode. Is it worth 50 dollars , yes it is. Great lens if you’re on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: scoobywrx05

customer_reviews.title: On par with canon
customer_reviews.text: This lens is great! I decided to go with Yongnuo after being through 3 of the (almost 3x as expensive) canon version because of the subpar build quality. Of course because this is a clone it holds the same quality and most everything about this lens is the same as the Canon one. It's slightly louder and takes a bit longer to find focus, but I don't mind. This lens is *not* rugged, but rather similar to the canon version so it should be treated with the same care. Bokeh is great and the optics are solid. Pros: 1.8 appeture Price Versatility Cons Build quality Noise Slow focus (photo was taken on T6i, 1.8 appeture, 1/100th iso200
customer_reviews.author: Aidan Francis

customer_reviews.title: the price is a lot cheaper and pretty much the same
customer_reviews.text: This lens is comparable to the 50mm 1.8, the price is a lot cheaper and pretty much the same. It's made out of cheaper material (maybe plastic) and is more light weight than the cannon lens, so it may be more susceptible to breaking but over all it takes quality pictures. I would recommend this to anyone who doesn't want to fork out the extra bucks. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amber B.

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic fantastic lens I would recommend this to anybody I love it I enjoy it I use it at every photo shoot.for beginners I would recommend this for intermediate I would recommend this and for professionals in advance to I would recommend this lens it is better than the Canon 50mm lens so I would definitely definitely buy this brand and find this lens the only negative thing is is it doesn't have the screw on the outside of the lens to put on any filters or to put on any hoods or anything like that but you can always buy one of the rubber extendable ones which I did which is awesome and fits it perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Karla burright

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is pretty good, the material is plasticky tho. You should be fine as long as u take care of it. It’s good as a first lens to check out what a 1.8 aperture and bokeh looks like. And give you an idea of what expensive lens you want to buy next for your photography style your going for.
customer_reviews.author: Bro2015

customer_reviews.title: Just go ahead and by the Canon 50.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in lieu of canon's nifty 50, mostly due to the pricing point being so low. Lesson learned there. I ended up using a friends Canon 50mm and liked it's performance so much better I bought one of my own. This lens performs adequately, but has nowhere near the clarity or focus speed of the Canon. I would consider it a very basic lens for someone that is just toying with photography. Honestly, if I had retained the box it came in, I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Does not seem to communicate well with my canon rebel ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not seem to communicate well with my canon rebel 2ti. There is a lag in the shutter and pics are often blurry. User error could for sure me a factor, but my canon lens doesn't give me the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Portrait Photographer-Freelance-PERFECT lens!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today and took it out right away. Perfection. The images are beautiful. It'll take a little playing around to get my focus just right, but the lens itself is amazing. EDIT: Had the lens about 2 months now and right before the ceremony to a wedding I did on Saturday started, the lens froze up and wouldn't budge. I've tried everything and it doesn't work anymore:/
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Good lens - beware of battery drain
customer_reviews.text: The lens does what I wanted it to do in terms of taking photos, but the lens drains my camera's battery pack while in the "off" position, which is annoying. I've found I have to remove the battery from my camera body to retain a charge between uses if I leave the lens attached. I've done a little research and found this to be a fairly common occurrence with YOUNGNO products. I'd still buy the lens again, given the significant savings over the same Canon lens, but buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Pichea

customer_reviews.title: Good that it was cheap
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lens quickly to do a shoot. I should have borrowed a friends lens. This is just what you pay for, a cheap lens. It did the job but now it sits in the backup closet. Thank goodness I was able to get my Canon lens back from repair before I needed it again. All that being said, it did work. I'm just not used to being able to shake a lens and having it rattle.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Great, amazing quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I expected the Lens to be much slower and noisier focusing. However, it is not that bad. It is not on the same level as the autofocus on the original canon 18-55 Lens but it's not far. The image quality is quite nice. The materials feel kind of cheap but very good for the price. I could not expect more for what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Horovitz

customer_reviews.title: It’s a cheap temporary alternative
customer_reviews.text: The lens was great for it’s price, with the downside of the mechanical auto-focus that can be heard while filming. For photography, it has a decent bokeh effect but it slightly curves at the corners of the frame. If you can look past the slight distortion (or make the best out of it) it can go a long way, but I mostly recommend it as a temporary lens until you can afford a Canon branded. After 2-3 years of use the focus mechanism finally broke on me.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This was deleted the first time I tried to review it for no good reason. So here it is again. Does exactly what I need it to do! I do mainly concert photography but > haven't had a chance to do that yet, but my test shots on my boyfriend and > cats were all the proof I needed. Surprised at the quality for how cheap it > is. I always avoid the more expensive brand name if I can help it and this > one lives up to expectations. 10/10 do recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: caty sullivan

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this lens and I use it almost all the ...
customer_reviews.text: As said in the other reviews, remember to take the little covers off on the lenses beforehand, really makes a huge difference on what you're reviewing. I absolutely love this lens and I use it almost all the time. The problems of sharpness and color can be easily corrected with post processing so there's not really a huge problem with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Average Neighbor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Despite what others are saying this lens isn't quite as sharp and doesn't produce as buttery soft of a bokeh as the canon nifty fifty, but honestly the difference is negligible. I carry it around as my everyday lens at work because I get great results and if I break it no big deal. It dies feel cheap but still works fine and I'm very rough on it. Value 5-stars Clarity 4-stars Bokeh 4-stars Feel 3-stars Build 4-stars Overall 4.5-stars!
customer_reviews.author: Gohan74

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Lens!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lens a lot. For the price it’s hard to beat for a beginner. I just got into photography earlier this year and this was the first lens I purchased. It made photography fun and something I enjoyed. I mostly take photos of my family. I don’t post them online, so I don’t have photos to share. But this and my zoom lens are what I often run around with when shooting. I learned a lot using this 50mm.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome Bokeh!
customer_reviews.text: This lens has some amazing Bokeh and wonderful detail. Honestly, I haven't really tried low light as much as I should've tested. However, in daylight she's faster than I expected. The autofocus isn't super super fast, but it isn't as loud as other reviewers say. Maybe they have a lemon because I have heard louder. Definitely a really good choice for those who want a cheap solution to portrait photography. The pictures I have attached are of my girlfriends senior pictures that I took with the lens. F1.8 1/4000 ISO 100
customer_reviews.author: SumTiemZ

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner 50 mm
customer_reviews.text: I saw this product evaluated by a Youtuber. So I decided to check it out and learned that quite a few people thought this is a decent lens for its price for someone starting photography. So I bought one. It works wells. The only slight drawback is that the auto-focus is audible. I suppose if you are not shooting video, it should not matter that much.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, doesnt last.
customer_reviews.text: Owned this lens for two months before it gave up on me. At first I'd give this lens five stars because in most cases it was better than the name brand. After the two months the lens just would no focus, and made weird noises. If you want a budget lens go for it, but get the warranty. Its a paper weight only after two months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT autofocus -AT ALL! GREAT for manual focus.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a starter lens for a manual photography class. I'd return this if it didnt suit my needs, but it does as I'm only using this for MANUAL focus. But this lens will NOT auto focus at all. It wont even get close. It tries, but that's all it does... constantly try. I'm using this with a canon T7, so if you're looking for a manual lens for portrait shooting, this is for you, if not, dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: NOtracking#=1starRATING

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the price. If you're upgrading from your kit lens for the first time, I recommend this lens a thousand times over. Budget friendly, but still sharp. However, if you have an aps-c (crop sensor, like the Canon Rebel series for example) then be aware this lens behaves like an 85mm lens. If you're wanting something that behaves more as a 50mm, look for a 35mm lens. With that being said, this lens works so much bettet than I expected at such a low price.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Like most reviewers, I was surprised of the quality of this off-brand lens. I used it on my Canon Rebel T5i camera and it has been working VERY well! I would definitely recommend this lens or buy it again. I'm looking into buying other lenses from YONGNUO as well. I have had it for over 6 months and it is currently my go-to lens for all of my photography but especially portraiture.
customer_reviews.author: AmarantinePhotographyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Solid lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this lens quite a bit in the last few weeks and have been very happy with it. Don't be put off by the off-brand name, is a solid lens for the price. Update: Clumsy me dropped my lens and broke it, so I bought a new one. The new one has major problems with autofocus. The image quality is still very good, but it rarely manages to find focus and is essentially only useful as a manual focus lens, which is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldy

customer_reviews.title: If you want a good 50mm to play around with pull the trigger
customer_reviews.text: I like photography as a hobby. I always wanted a 50mm with a a low f stop to get that "look". Without spending a fortune I went with this and was blown away how with such little money you really get a quality lens. Amazing. Only complaint is it has a gloss ring on the lens that's prone to scratches and not as high build quality as name brand. But honestly I'm stretching for things to complain about. Amazing lens. Amazing quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Meador

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: I took a ton of photography classed in high school. about 12 years ago. I decided to get back into it about a year ago. I am far from a great or good photographer. I have relearned from a lot of what I sorta knew from youtube. I have only had this sense for a short time. This is a great entry level lens. Great for the price. My one complaint is the focus ring is a bit small. Nothing to regret buying it for.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzzly

customer_reviews.title: It's great as long as you don;t use autofocus in video mode.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great lens. But you get what you pay for. If you;re a beginner in photography, and you're looking to get away from the lens that came with the camera and take some pictures with "blurry backgrounds," then this is your lens. Pro's: The Price can't be beat. The f1.8 aperture is great. Meh: Sharpness at edges is what you'd expect at this price-point. Cons: Autofocus is noisy and has a hard time maintaining focus while filming. Plastic build (seems sturdy though.)
customer_reviews.author: Al Church

customer_reviews.title: Good lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This was a replacement from a Canon lens. No comparison when it comes to the quality. Yungnuo lends is lightweight due to all the plastic. The focusing is not the fastest and when on manual focus it felt too loose. With that said, if I had to replace it again, the price makes up for it. I don’t use a 50 that often so this should last me awhile. If I used it on a regular basis, I am not sure how long it would stand up. Good lense for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy R

customer_reviews.title: YONGNUO YN50mm F1.8
customer_reviews.text: This works, the people at Yonguno know what they're doing I have not test this against the Canon 50mm lens yet. This is my first low-light lens and I am stoked to have it work so great. The aperture open at f1.8 is magical for blurred backgrounds. The lens doesn't come with image stabilization but still works pretty well for video. Auto focus work great, quick and responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Jurne Molina

customer_reviews.title: big bang for $$$
customer_reviews.text: i just got this yesterday and put it on my Canon T6. fits perfect,. it is smooth quick focus. i only had a chance to take a few pix, decent close up. camera is 18mp and photos are cropped 50-75%. i like the 1.8 and got it for astro photos but havent had a chance to test that. i also have a sony a6000 and got the canon to sony converter. want to do testing on that as the sony a6000 is 24 mp camera. i gave it 4 stars because of limited use/test. but so far so good and the price was great.
customer_reviews.author: DLN

customer_reviews.title: Nice little inexpensive lens
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleasantly surprised by how well this lens works. I really wanted a 50mm but did not want to pay outrageous prices for it. This one is a great price and takes amazing pictures. Like others have said the auto focus may take a little time to find focus and may be a bit loud but I normally use manual focus anyway. The couple of times I did use this on autofocus, the amount of time it took to focus and the noise did not bother me. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lanich

customer_reviews.title: First day, so far, just what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was after. Sharp. Razor thin focus. When added to the MOVO extender rings (from Amazon) some acceptable macro. Due to issues lining up contacts on the rings, I have a second lens on the way that I will fiddle with till they all work. Yes, the focus motor is audible, but whatever I'm taking with this will either already know I am it won't care.
customer_reviews.author: unit63x

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE:  Broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this well-rated lens in April 2017, for occasional use. This past weekend, on its third time out, lens started making noise and the focus malfunctioned. I realized I had a SERIOUS problem when I unmounted it from my camera body, and heard _something_ rattling around inside the lens - it sounds like loose pieces/parts. I'd lobby for my money back, but warranty term has expired. I will not buy again, and do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vixenlady

customer_reviews.title: 50mm lens does what it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned any primary lenses. So this is my first. I’ve watched multiple reviews on it, majority of them were good. What I will say I I have a canon t6. It fits perfectly, and does what it’s supposed to do. The AF does take a little longer than it would on the canon 50mm 1.8 but I don’t shoot in AF only MF. And even in video I find it does a better job being used in MF. No complaints. Nothing bad to say. For the price it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Diam Ond

customer_reviews.title: Cheap entry level and quality.  Worth a quick buy to mess around with.
customer_reviews.text: Good enough lens for a nifty fifty. Autofocus is LOUD and hunts like crazy so I use mainly in manual. My images didnt appear to have much chromatic aberration and there was occasional lens flaring but I threw a generic lens hood on it and all that stopped. This thing is cheaply made but the glass seems nice and the bokeh it creates is great. I'd recommend this to anyone wanting a 50mm with large aperture for cheap. Seriously tho dont expect mind blowing sharpness but to the untrained eye the quality is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Section 80

customer_reviews.title: No Thank You
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this lens. I have the Sigma 17-50 mm 2.8 and I bought this lens for portraits. I thought it would be sharper than my Sigma and would give me a blurrier background. While the background is more blurred with this lens, so are my images. I don't like blurry subjects. My Sigma is sharper. I was excited about this lens after reading so many favorable reviews. I'm disappointed that it didn't work out for me. Maybe I got a bad copy?
customer_reviews.author: dk3000

customer_reviews.title: Was told about this lens from a friend at work
customer_reviews.text: Fell in love with this lens once I got it, very crisp photos, I use it more of a portrait lens then every day I have a hard time not having a zoom, but when I want crisp fast lens this is my go-to, all pictures ive posted with this review were taken with this lens
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Owned for about a year. Pic quality I have no complaints about, but durability, horrible. Plastic body feels cheap. Had to baby it ever stop if the way. Autofocus always got jammed up after removing from my camera bag. Almost a year to date the plastic just crumbled in my hand. For price I shouldn’t have expected more. Couple weeks later I just went and invested in a more reliable Canon 50mm that I should’ve purchased from the beginning. Good luck if ya choose it... get as much experience in while it lasts
customer_reviews.author: J Wash

customer_reviews.title: Stops focusing after a month with No Customer Support.
customer_reviews.text: Not even after a month of owning it, the lens has stopped focusing completely. I would rather put my money in a Canon 50mm 1.8 Lens. They do not offer warranty for sellers outside of their own website and they will not contact you back even if you email them. If you want a long lasting lens with actual warranty get the canon 50mm 1.8, as other reviewers have stated the difference in quality is negligible or even worse for some.
customer_reviews.author: APX

customer_reviews.title: Not Even Close to Canon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the reviews and discovered that the photo quality was much poorer compared to the Canon I replaced it with. Many photos came out blurry and poorly focused. I don't know if I received a defective one, but no photos came out clear.
customer_reviews.author: SilentStorm

customer_reviews.title: I never expected it to perform like it has
customer_reviews.text: This $50 lens works so well. I never expected it to perform like it has. I use it with my Canon Rebel. It is noisy, but I couldn't care less. It's so clear. If you are close up and focused on a singular spot it fuzzes up the background and foreground, but I like that. It took clear regular shots without me standing half a room away at my kindergartener's Christmas party.
customer_reviews.author: Dunn Girls

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Canon nifty fifty that succumb to a fungal bloom and started to decline in performance. I have to say that, for $50, I’ve never seen a better lens. This performs as well as the Canon did before I had problems, and even maybe a bit better. It gives beautiful bokeh, crisp images, it’s just really lovely to work with. It’s a lot of lens for a little bit of money.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa McGowan

customer_reviews.title: Not the canon version, but very close for cost.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so it's a cheap clone of the canon 50mm. And it's ok. It just is sooooooooo slow when it comes to focusing. That being said it takes some beautiful photos. No it's not as good as the canon version. But it comes really close and is wayyyyy cheaper. I definitely think I want try more of there lenses when I can afford them. They seem to be reasonably priced for what you get. I definitly think this is a fantastic lense for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value. No regrets getting this over the Canon Nifty Fifty
customer_reviews.text: I don't own a Canon Nifty Fifty, so don't look here for a comparison. Focus is a bit slow if you're used to USM and as it's not STM, it's a bit loud. I went in knowing both of those things, so no surprises. Just might be a limiting factor depending on where you're shooting. Picture quality is great, even wide open. Low light performance is what you'd expect for an f/1.8. Extremely happy with this and not regretting going with this over the Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I was tight on funds when I got this and glad I didn't spend a lot on it. I have taken some great photos on it but it just doesn't have a real good sharpness to my pictures. I do really like it and do really dislike it. You will not have the quality of a more expensive lenses but if you are tight on a budget or for a beginner then this will work.
customer_reviews.author: mom_w2kids

customer_reviews.title: Saved $100 or more over Canon lens, beautiful results!
customer_reviews.text: Sosososososo pleased with this lens. I feel like I've stepped up my portrait game in one simple purchase! Normally a Canon diehard, and one who feels like quality is usually tied to brand name...I took a chance and wanted to save $100 over the equivalent Canon lens. So glad I did. Very happy with the results, and saving money!
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Liked it until it SHUT MY CAMERA DOWN during a wedding!
customer_reviews.text: The image quality that it had the first time i used it looked decent, so I took it to a wedding I was shooting and it made my camera fail (literally gave an error message about accessory failure that the lens wouldn't communicate to device) which I have NEVER had before! Switched it onto my other camera body and same issue. I'm not a happy camper and would like a refund. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Rolyn

customer_reviews.title: The images aren't as sharp and the focusing is pretty loud. I ended up buying the Canon brand ...
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok lens for a beginner. The images aren't as sharp and the focusing is pretty loud. I ended up buying the Canon brand because I just wasn't satisfied with the photos from this lens. I would return it but I don't have the original packaging so now it's just a paper weight. I recommend just spending the extra for the Canon
customer_reviews.author: Naima Ruchel

customer_reviews.title: It probably sounds like it isn't a big deal
customer_reviews.text: I think it's safe to say it definitely gets the job done. The clarity of the photos is as expected, so no complaints there. The only thing keeping it from five stars is how long it takes to focus. It whirs in and out on Auto Focus and requires patience, causing irritation. It probably sounds like it isn't a big deal, but it's enough to lose a star. However, I think it's definitely worth what you save through buying this as opposed to buying the Canon brand. I use it on my Canon 70D for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei T.

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this lens because I'm a beginner and thought that it sounded too good to be true. However, I packed it this weekend on a trip to New Orleans and it was AMAZING! I originally had the Canon 50mm and it was stolen right before my trip so I needed a cheap alternative. I was able to capture some truly amazing shots with this lens. I would definitely recommend for anyone looking for that close up quality without having to pay an arm and leg.
customer_reviews.author: Kici C.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is not bad, but I would not buy again like I had thought I would. I read a previous review of receiving an error message after a few hundred photos they had taken. I just received mine today, took maybe 4 photos and received the same error message. I rather have a reliable lens than receiving error messages on photoshoots, I was testing to see if I could get away with going off brand but I would not suggest unless you are just having fun and want a cheap lens that will take good photos but unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: fd

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: It's important to know that this is a cheap camera lens, both in quality and price. I picked it up out if the box and it just felt cheap -- don't expect it to feel like a name brand lens. I've taken it with me on photoshoots a few times and more than half the time the autofocus is too particular and won't take the picture. If you are willing to work with it and don't care about the cheap plastic, this could be your new favorite lens. I personally wouldn't consider it a good lens, though.
customer_reviews.author: deserved_hero

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for Canon EOS rebel SLR film camera
customer_reviews.text: I was going to use this on a canon EOS rebel film camera and it didn't work because the mirror hits it. Seemed alright other than that though. I ended up getting a used canon 50mm 1.8 prime lens off Ebay for 50 bucks instead.
customer_reviews.author: GEWeber

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: It's been less than 3 years and I've hardly used this lens, however it gives me a "communication error" with the camera every time I use it. Or, if I try to clean the contacts, it takes an all white photo. It's warranty is only 1 year, so looks like it's money down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: For a fraction of the cost of a Canon lens, this lens will blow you away. My brother-in-law who has a professional photography business on the side, was impressed with the quality of my photos (even though I'm still a pretty crummy photographer). It is a bit loud, as other reviewers have mentioned, but that is a minor issue when you consider the awesome lens you are getting for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Keenan

customer_reviews.title: ... started with photography and I'd say this lens is perfect for those who are tight on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I got my first DSLR on Christmas and got started with photography and I'd say this lens is perfect for those who are tight on a budget. And this will do the job fine if you're posting pictures on social media and nothing professional. However, your skill level will grow quickly as you get deeper into photography and you will realize that you want to replace this thing with canon's product or an even more expensive f/1.4 because it's a good investment. I do it as a hobby and do not make any money from photography but better picture quality is just for personal satisfaction. Taking nothing away from this lens, it's great for what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even semi professionals apparently recommend them. I am happy I did
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Yongnuo flash light after reading reviews of the quality and price. Even semi professionals apparently recommend them. I am happy I did! This lens was my second Yongnuo product and so far I am very happy with it. An excellent lens for the price. I wish they would make a larger variety of other lenses and products. (by the way, try their flashes too)
customer_reviews.author: Johan

customer_reviews.title: Great for school events
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a lens that would let me take pictures in a school theater and in a gymnasium-- both locations with low light and fast moving subjects. I was worried that the lack of image stabilization would show up in my images, but because you can shoot so fast, it turned out not to be a problem. I have used this lens at a school play and some volleyball games and I've been happy. It was well worth the $50. The pics are a little noisy because I had the ISO up very high, but these kind of shots were impossible to get at all when I was using smaller apertures.
customer_reviews.author: Preserved Killick

customer_reviews.title: Much better than hoped
customer_reviews.text: You read these reviews and you'd be tempted to think that the focus motor is louder than a locomotive and slower than molasses. Nothing could further from the truth in reality it is a FANTASTIC little lens and at this price how can you go wrong? My only complaint is that I can't use my 58mm filters with it.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

product_meta.title: YONGNUO YN50mm F1.8 Standard Prime Lens Large Aperture Auto Focus Lens for Canon EF Mount Rebel DSLR Camera
feature_bullets: Yongnuo Lens EF 50mm 1.8 for Canon is a 50mm auto fucus lens for creative, art and beauty photography. The wide aperture of 1.8 enables a shallow dept of field.
F1.8 large aperture,virtual background,which makes photography with more fun.
Support auto focus and manual focus mode;
Adopts gold plating for the metal contacts,effectively improve the signal conductivity and corrosion resistance;
Supports M/AV/TV/P and other camera shooting modes,and can be displayed the aperture data in the EXIF Information;

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,233 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
